result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion to Modify Court Costs signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to modify court costs.
Letter from defendant regarding DOC deductions.
Original SENTENCING Transcript (24 pages) commencing OCTOBER 15, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Victim was notified but did not appear.
.
As to count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent with count 3 but consecutive to the sentence the defendant is currently serving, -0- credit.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. 
.
As to count 3:
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent with count 2 but consecutive to the sentence the defendant is currently serving, -0- credit.

COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge.
- Defendant to pay all other fees, surcharges and assessments during his period of extended supervision on case 15CF3868.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to have no contact with the victim.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. 

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is calendared for a jury trial today.
As to counts 2 and 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the penalty enhancer, "Repeater" dismissed.
As to counts 2 and 3 as amended:
 Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for a sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant rejects State's offer. State informs the court that they will be charging an additional case. State will provide additional discovery to the defense regarding the additional charges. Case remains calendared on 09/02/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 36.
If defense wishes to resolve this case counsel should contact the court for an earlier date prior to trial.

Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in custody.  Sarah Zwach supervised by Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:Jody W and her children including HPJ dob: 8/22/06; KJH dob: 10/23/14

Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jerrick Darnisha Henderson in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 2 and Count 3.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriffs  Department to obtain DNA from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
